message.content:
cs.AR, cs.ET, cs.DC, cs.SE, cs.SY

The paper focuses on the design of digital systems that are resilient to reliability failures, specifically radiation-induced soft errors in processor cores. This falls under the category of computer architecture (cs.AR) and electronic devices and systems (cs.ET). The paper also discusses various techniques for achieving resilience, including circuit-level hardening, logic-level parity checking, and micro-architectural recovery, which are related to digital circuits (cs.DC) and software engineering (cs.SE). Finally, the paper presents a framework for exploring cross-layer resilience, which involves multiple layers of the system stack, including circuit, logic, architecture, software, and algorithm, making it relevant to systems and control (cs.SY).
